column5: hey guys i was looking through the BPS flyer this morning and noticed a a few good deals, how is the Browning Aggressor Combo, for 59.88, is this a good buy? also the President spinning reel for 39.99, looks like a nice reel, or the Abu Garcia Cardinal 100 spinning reel for 34.88, does anyone have any info or experience with these tools, TIA
Here is a good value combo. Berkely Lightning Rod from BPS for $18 Daiwa Crossfire -3i reel from LeB for $22  A nice back-up combo or to let friends use when you take them out.
I have two of the Pflueger Presidents series and recommend them highly. Very smooth and fairly stout especially for 40 bucks.

I have another pflueger and like it and have used the President and they are smooth and I too would reccomend them. as for the brownings as mentioned in the past should stick to what they know, being firearms...
thnx guys, the president looks great, ill  consider the browning

Have you guys come across the Daiwa Steez 103HL? i seen it at the spring fishing show and alls i gotta say is its the lightest baitcaster "5.5 ounces" i ever touched but its kinda heavy on the wallet. heres a link of the specs: http://www.tackletour.com/reviewdaiwasteez.html  This is something i wont be picking up anytime soon, i received the BPS spring sale flyer and and did a circle check on it for items i will be purchasing.
Bought that for ice fishing, sweet reel for the price, even comes with two spools, but the drag aint the best.

I had a president, lasted 1 season until all the bearings seized up, even after I took it apart and lubed everything it didn't come back to life same thing happened to another 10bb reel, so I tend to stick with no more than 6bb, they are smooth while they last.
i'd go with the Shimano Stradic MgFA with a GLoomis Rod.
What does that have to do with combos priced under $75??
Browning reels will only teach you how to dismantle a reel over and over for repairs.  I would only buy there rods
Never mentioned anywhere for a price under $75.  Where do you see that?
what kinda reel you want? spin?bait? and what your use? like species?
both lol, i smooth reel for finesse fishing for bass, pike, a baitcaster for tossing spoons, bigger spinner baits, i perfer a 5:1 speed

Last year, the Aggressor was $99.  For $60, you might want to look into it.  Decent rod, and maybe they fixed the problems with the reel.  Cardinal 100 is nice, but small.  It wouldn't make a good bass, pike, or carp reel.  I still haven't seen the flyer, so I don't know what's on sale.
